summary: A vulnerability in the hashbrown Rust dependency (GHSA-wwq9-3cpr-mm53) was reported in the TypeScript SDK's core-bridge. The team assessed the risk as low for Temporal's use case since hashbrown is never used in security-sensitive contexts or with user-controlled input.
userImpact: Minimal direct impact to users as the vulnerable hashbrown dependency is not used in security-sensitive contexts within the SDK.
rootCause: hashbrown dependency contained a vulnerability (GHSA-wwq9-3cpr-mm53) in the core-bridge Rust component
proposedFix: Update hashbrown and other Rust dependencies to patched versions
resolutionDetails: Released version 1.11.7 with updated hashbrown dependency
keyQuote: this specific issue wouldn't represent a vulnerability in the context of Temporal's TS SDK, as 1) we never use object comparison in any security sensitive context
